GA 3.1
  • Get started
  • Reference

Summary for Genetic Algorithms

summary.ga-method.Rd

Summary method for class ga-class.

# S4 method for ga
summary(object, …)

# S3 method for summary.ga
print(x, digits = getOption("digits"), …)

Arguments

object

an object of class ga-class.
x

an object of class summary.ga.
digits

number of significant digits.
…

further arguments passed to or from other methods.

Value

The summary function returns an object of class summary.ga which can be printed by the corresponding print method. The function also returns invisibly a list with the information from the genetic algorithm search.

See also

ga

Examples

f <- function(x)  abs(x)+cos(x)
GA <- ga(type = "real-valued",
         fitness = function(x) -f(x),
         lower = -20, upper = 20, run = 50)
#> GA | iter = 1 | Mean = -9.243660 | Best = -1.243839

#> GA | iter = 100 | Mean = -3.538535 | Best = -1.000097
out <- summary(GA)
print(out)
#> ── Genetic Algorithm ─────────────────── 
#> 
#> GA settings: 
#> Type                  =  real-valued 
#> Population size       =  50 
#> Number of generations =  100 
#> Elitism               =  2 
#> Crossover probability =  0.8 
#> Mutation probability  =  0.1 
#> Search domain = 
#>        x1
#> lower -20
#> upper  20
#> 
#> GA results: 
#> Iterations             = 100 
#> Fitness function value = -1.000097 
#> Solution = 
#>                  x1
#> [1,] -0.00009700656
str(out)
#> List of 11
#>  $ type       : chr "real-valued"
#>  $ popSize    : num 50
#>  $ maxiter    : num 100
#>  $ elitism    : num 2
#>  $ pcrossover : num 0.8
#>  $ pmutation  : num 0.1
#>  $ domain     : num [1:2, 1] -20 20
#>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2
#>   .. ..$ : chr [1:2] "lower" "upper"
#>   .. ..$ : chr "x1"
#>  $ suggestions: NULL
#>  $ iter       : int 100
#>  $ fitness    : num -1
#>  $ solution   : num [1, 1] -0.000097
#>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2
#>   .. ..$ : NULL
#>   .. ..$ : chr "x1"
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "summary.ga"
